name: USCorePatientProfile
title: US Core Patient Profile
description: The US Core Patient Profile meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v3 'Patient Demographics' requirements. This profile sets minimum expectations for the Patient resource to record, search, and fetch basic demographics and other administrative information about an individual patient. It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource when using this profile to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: An Extension

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: extension
elements.description:
Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.  The race codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC Race and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 921 reference race.  The race concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 5 OMB race categories:

   - American Indian or Alaska Native
   - Asian
   - Black or African American
   - Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
   - White.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: extension
elements.description: Concepts classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality.  The ethnicity codes used to represent these concepts are based upon the [CDC ethnicity and Ethnicity Code Set Version 1.0](http://www.cdc.gov/phin/resources/vocabulary/index.html) which includes over 900 concepts for representing race and ethnicity of which 43 reference ethnicity.  The ethnicity concepts are grouped by and pre-mapped to the 2 OMB ethnicity categories: - Hispanic or Latino - Not Hispanic or Latino.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: extension
elements.description: A tribe or band with which a person associates whether or not they are an enrolled member.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: A code classifying the person's sex assigned at birth  as specified by the [Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC)](https://www.healthit.gov/newsroom/about-onc).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: extension
elements.description: The US Core Sex Extension is used to reflect the documentation of a person's sex. It aligns with the C-CDA Sex Observation (LOINC 46098-0).

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

elements.description: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

elements.short: Time period when id is/was valid for use
elements.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

mapping.map: II.assigningAuthorityName but note that this is an improper use by the definition of the field.  Also Role.scoper

elements.name: active
elements.short: Whether this patient's record is in active use
elements.description:
Whether this patient record is in active use. 
Many systems use this property to mark as non-current patients, such as those that have not been seen for a period of time based on an organization's business rules.

It is often used to filter patient lists to exclude inactive patients

Deceased patients may also be marked as inactive for the same reasons, but may be active for some time after death.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: (USCDI) A name associated with the patient
elements.description: A name associated with the individual.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
At least name.given and/or name.family are present or, if neither is available, the Data Absent Reason Extension is present.
constraints.xpath: (/f:extension/@url='http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/data-absent-reason' and not(/f:family or /f:given)) or (not(/f:extension/@url='http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/data-absent-reason') and (/f:family or /f:given))

elements.name: use
elements.short: (USCDI) usual | official | temp | nickname | anonymous | old | maiden
elements.description: Identifies the purpose for this name.

binding.description: The use of a human name.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XPN.7, but often indicated by which field contains the name

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text representation of the full name
elements.description: Specifies the entire name as it should be displayed e.g. on an application UI. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: family
elements.description: The part of a name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: given
elements.short: (USCDI) Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names
elements.description: Given name.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: prefix
elements.short: Parts that come before the name
elements.description: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: suffix
elements.short: (USCDI) Parts that come after the name
elements.description: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: (USCDI) Time period when name was/is in use
elements.description: Indicates the period of time when this name was valid for the named person.

elements.short: (USCDI) home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point
elements.description: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.

mapping.map: XTN.2 - but often indicated by field

elements.name: rank
elements.short: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)
elements.description: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. ContactPoints with lower rank values are more preferred than those with higher rank values.

elements.name: period
elements.short: Time period when the contact point was/is in use
elements.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

elements.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

elements.short: (USCDI) home | work | temp | old | billing - purpose of this address

elements.name: type
elements.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

binding.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.description: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 + XAD.3 + XAD.4 + XAD.5 + XAD.6

elements.name: line
elements.short: (USCDI) Street name, number, direction & P.O. Box etc.
elements.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

elements.name: city
elements.description: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

elements.description: The name of the administrative area (county).

elements.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (e.g. US 2 letter state codes).

elements.name: postalCode
elements.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

elements.short: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)
elements.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

elements.short: (USCDI) Time period when address was/is in use
elements.description: Time period when address was/is in use.
